what: Download and Process Data from the Paleobiology Database
title: Download and Process Data from the Paleobiology Database
text: paleobioDB package downloading, visualizing processing data Paleobiology Database.

title: Download and Process Data from the Paleobiology Database
text: Install latest release CRAN: Alternatively, can install development version paleobioDB GitHub :

title: Download and Process Data from the Paleobiology Database
text: paleobioDB 19 functions wrap endpoints PaleobioDB API, plus 8 functions visualize process fossil data. API documentation Paleobiology Database can found .

title: Download and Process Data from the Paleobiology Database
text: example download fossil occurrences belong family Canidae Quaternary: Note plotting analysis functions package going used (demonstrated sections ), necessary specify parameter show = c("coords", "classext") pbdb_occurrences() function. returns taxonomic geographic information occurrences required functions.
code: library(paleobioDB)  canidae <- pbdb_occurrences(   base_name = "canidae",   interval = "Quaternary",   show = c("coords", "classext"),   vocab = "pbdb",   limit = "all" )  dim(canidae) #> [1] 1384   28  head(canidae, 3) #>   occurrence_no record_type collection_no   identified_name identified_rank #> 1        150070         occ         13293          Cuon sp.           genus #> 2        192926         occ         19617    Canis edwardii         species #> 3        192927         occ         19617 Canis armbrusteri         species #>   identified_no     accepted_name accepted_rank accepted_no     early_interval #> 1         41204              Cuon         genus       41204 Middle Pleistocene #> 2         44838    Canis edwardii       species       44838       Irvingtonian #> 3         44827 Canis armbrusteri       species       44827       Irvingtonian #>      late_interval max_ma min_ma reference_no       lng      lat   phylum #> 1 Late Pleistocene  0.781 0.0117         4412  111.5667 22.76667 Chordata #> 2             <NA>  1.800 0.3000         2673 -112.4000 35.70000 Chordata #> 3             <NA>  1.800 0.3000        52058 -112.4000 35.70000 Chordata #>   phylum_no    class class_no     order order_no  family family_no genus #> 1     33815 Mammalia    36651 Carnivora    36905 Canidae     41189  Cuon #> 2     33815 Mammalia    36651 Carnivora    36905 Canidae     41189 Canis #> 3     33815 Mammalia    36651 Carnivora    36905 Canidae     41189 Canis #>   genus_no reid_no difference #> 1    41204    <NA>       <NA> #> 2    41198    8376       <NA> #> 3    41198   30222       <NA>

title: Download and Process Data from the Paleobiology Database
text: Beware synonyms errors, twist estimations species richness, evolutionary extinction rates, etc. paleobioDB users critical raw data downloaded database filter data analyzing . instance, using base_name downloading information function pbdb_occurrences(), check synonyms errors appear accepted_name, genus, etc. corrected eliminated, increase richness genera.

title: Download and Process Data from the Paleobiology Database
text: Plots map showing fossil occurrences invisibly returns data frame number occurrences per coordinate.

title: Download and Process Data from the Paleobiology Database
text: Returns map raster object sampling effort (number fossil records per cell). user can change resolution cells.
code: pbdb_map_occur(canidae, res = 5) #> class       : SpatRaster  #> dimensions  : 34, 74, 1  (nrow, ncol, nlyr) #> resolution  : 5, 5  (x, y) #> extent      : -180, 190, -85.19218, 84.80782  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> coord. ref. : lon/lat WGS 84  #> source(s)   : memory #> name        : sum  #> min value   :   1  #> max value   :  67

title: Download and Process Data from the Paleobiology Database
text: Returns map raster object number different species, genera, family, etc. per cell. pbdb_map_occur(), user can change resolution cells.  need plot interested obtaining richness raster purposes, use argument do_plot = FALSE. instance, returns raster object (SpatRaster object terra package) without plotting : do_plot argument available functions package produce plot return object. means plot optional plotting functions described . Check documentation details.
code: pbdb_map_richness(canidae, res = 5, rank = "species") #> class       : SpatRaster  #> dimensions  : 34, 74, 1  (nrow, ncol, nlyr) #> resolution  : 5, 5  (x, y) #> extent      : -180, 190, -85.19218, 84.80782  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> coord. ref. : lon/lat WGS 84  #> source(s)   : memory #> name        : sum  #> min value   :   1  #> max value   :  14 pbdb_map_richness(canidae, res = 5, rank = "species", do_plot = FALSE) #> class       : SpatRaster  #> dimensions  : 34, 74, 1  (nrow, ncol, nlyr) #> resolution  : 5, 5  (x, y) #> extent      : -180, 190, -85.19218, 84.80782  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> coord. ref. : lon/lat WGS 84  #> source(s)   : memory #> name        : sum  #> min value   :   1  #> max value   :  14

title: Download and Process Data from the Paleobiology Database
text: Returns data frame plot time span species, genera, families, etc. query. Make sure enough vertical space provided graphics device used plotting many taxa specified rank data set.
code: pbdb_temp_range(canidae, rank = "species") #>                             max    min #> Canis lepophagus          4.900 0.0120 #> Canis gezi                4.000 0.7810 #> Canis chihliensis         3.600 0.7810 #> Canis palmidens           3.600 0.7810 #> Eucyon minor              3.600 0.7810 .... #> Urocyon littoralis        0.300 0.0000 #> Pseudalopex sechurae      0.126 0.0117 #> Vulpes macrotis           0.126 0.0117 #> Cubacyon transversidens   0.126 0.0000 #> Lycalopex griseus         0.126 0.0000 #> Speothos pacivorus        0.126 0.0000

title: Download and Process Data from the Paleobiology Database
text: include Dockerfile ease working package fulfills system dependencies. load package Docker: Install Docker. Reference : https://docs.docker.com/get-started/ Build docker image. root folder repository, type: command create docker image system based rocker/tidyverse images. can see new image docker image ls. Start container image. Type following command picking <password> choice. start container access current folder code package . Inside container, code located /home/rstudio. also exposes port 8787 container may access RStudio web application bundled Rocker base image. , can either: Navigate http://localhost:8787. Enter username “rstudio” password used command . can enter container via console : Either RStudio within container can install package source : finished, can stop container:
code: docker build -t rpbdb Docker docker run -d --name="rpbdb_rstudio" --rm -p 8787:8787 \        -e PASSWORD=<password> -v $PWD:/home/rstudio rpbdb docker exec -ti -u rstudio -w /home/rstudio rpbdb_rstudio R install.packages(".", repos = NULL, type = "source") docker container stop rpbdb_rstudio

what:
paleobioDB: An R-package for downloading, visualizing and
processing data from the Paleobiology Database — paleobioDB
title:
paleobioDB: An R-package for downloading, visualizing and
processing data from the Paleobiology Database — paleobioDB
text: developed paleobioDB, R-package designed make easy flexible queries Paleobiology Database, well visualize download selected data. package make easy access paleontological data way allow data analyzed, including via packages libraries available R.

title:
paleobioDB: An R-package for downloading, visualizing and
processing data from the Paleobiology Database — paleobioDB
text: programmed two different groups functions. First, developed set general flexible functions wrap PaleobioDB API. functions connect R endpoints PaleobioDB API. Second, based base functions, programmed second set functions intended explore visualize fossil occurrences geographic, temporal taxonomic dimensions.

title:
paleobioDB: An R-package for downloading, visualizing and
processing data from the Paleobiology Database — paleobioDB
text: Sara Varela, Javier González-Hernández, Luciano Fabris Sgarbi, Charles Marshall, Mark D. Uhen, Shanan Peters, Michael McClennen, 2015. paleobioDB: R package downloading, visualizing processing data Paleobiology Database. Ecography, 38: 419-425. doi:10.1111/ecog.01154

title:
paleobioDB: An R-package for downloading, visualizing and
processing data from the Paleobiology Database — paleobioDB
text: Sara Varela sara.varela@uvigo.gal Javier Gonzalez javigzz@yahoo.es Luciano Fabris Sgarbi luciano.f.sgarbi@gmail.com

title:
paleobioDB: An R-package for downloading, visualizing and
processing data from the Paleobiology Database — paleobioDB
code: if (FALSE) { canidae <- pbdb_occurrences(   vocab = "pbdb",   limit = "all",   base_name = "canidae",   interval = "Quaternary",   show = c("coords", "classext", "ident") )  ## to explore the number of subtaxa pbdb_subtaxa(canidae)  ## to explore the temporal resolution of the fossil records pbdb_temporal_resolution(canidae)  ## returns a data frame and a plot with the temporal span ## of the species, genera, etc. pbdb_temp_range(canidae, rank = "genus", names = FALSE)  ## returns a data frame and a plot showing the species, genera, etc. ## richness across time pbdb_richness(canidae, rank = "species", temporal_extent = c(0, 10), res = 1)  ## returns a data frame and a plot showing the evolutionary ## and extinction rates across time  ## evolutionary rates: orig_ext = 1 pbdb_orig_ext(   canidae,   rank = "species", temporal_extent = c(0, 10), res = 1,   orig_ext = 1 )  ## extinction rates: orig_ext = 2 pbdb_orig_ext(   canidae,   rank = "species", temporal_extent = c(0, 10), res = 1,   orig_ext = 2 )  ## maps the fossil occurrences pbdb_map(canidae, main = "Canidae", pch = 19, cex = 0.7)  ## maps the sampling effort pbdb_map_occur(canidae, res = 5)  ## maps the species, genera, etc. richness pbdb_map_richness(canidae, rank = "species", res = 5)  }

what: Get information about a single collection record — pbdb_collection
title: Get information about a single collection record — pbdb_collection
text: Returns information single collection record Paleobiology Database.

title: Get information about a single collection record — pbdb_collection
Get information about a single collection record — pbdb_collection
text: id Identifier collection. parameter required. ... Additional arguments passed API. See available arguments https://paleobiodb.org/data1.2/colls/single. E.g.: vocab: Set "pbdb" show complete name variables (default variables short 3-letter names). show: Select additional blocks information returned along basic record.  possible values include: "loc": Additional information geographic locality collection "stratext": Detailed information stratigraphic context collection. "lithext": Detailed information lithological context collection.

title: Get information about a single collection record — pbdb_collection
text: data frame single occurrence.

title: Get information about a single collection record — pbdb_collection
text: Go pbdb_occurrences() see explanation main parameters.

what: Get information about geographic clusters of collections — pbdb_collections_geo
title: Get information about geographic clusters of collections — pbdb_collections_geo
text: path returns information geographic clusters collections Paleobiology Database. clusters defined order facilitate generation maps low resolutions. can make config request via https://paleobiodb.org/data1.2/config order get list available summary levels.

title: Get information about geographic clusters of collections — pbdb_collections_geo
Get information about geographic clusters of collections — pbdb_collections_geo
text: level integer specifying cluster level. Refer https://paleobiodb.org/data1.2/config.txt?show=clusters list available resolution levels ("cluster_level" column). ... Documentation parameters available https://paleobiodb.org/data1.2/colls/summary. Go pbdb_occurrences() see explanation main filtering parameters.

title: Get information about geographic clusters of collections — pbdb_collections_geo
text: data frame collections match query.

title: Get information about geographic clusters of collections — pbdb_collections_geo
code: if (FALSE) {   pbdb_collections_geo(     level = 2,     vocab = "pbdb",     lngmin = 0.0, lngmax = 15.0, latmin = 0.0, latmax = 15.0   ) }

what: Get information about a single interval — pbdb_interval
title: Get information about a single interval — pbdb_interval

title: Get information about a single interval — pbdb_interval
Get information about a single interval — pbdb_interval
text: ... Additional arguments passed API. See documentation accepted parameters https://paleobiodb.org/data1.2/intervals/single. Either name id must specified, used query: name: Returns interval specified name. id: Returns interval corresponding specified identifier. vocab: Set "pbdb" show complete name variables (default variables short 3-letter names).

Get information about multiple intervals — pbdb_intervals
text: ... arguments passed API. See documentation accepted parameters https://paleobiodb.org/data1.2/intervals/list. E.g.: min_ma: Return intervals least old. max_ma: Return intervals old. order: Return intervals order starting specified. Possible values include "age", "name". Defaults "age". vocab: Set "pbdb" show complete name variables (default variables short 3-letter names).

Map the fossil records — pbdb_map
text: function opens new window map showing distribution fossil records points. points coloured according number occurrences per cell.

title: Map the fossil records — pbdb_map
code: pbdb_map(   data,   col_int = "white",   pch = 19,   col_ocean = "black",   main = NULL,   col_point = c("light blue", "blue"),   do_plot = TRUE,   ... )

title: Map the fossil records — pbdb_map
text: data Input data frame. data frame output pbdb_occurrences() function using argument show = "coords". See also Details Examples. col_int colour mainland. pch See par(). col_ocean colour ocean. main Title map. See par(). col_point Two colours used generate colour gradient showing number occurrences per coordinate map. do_plot Logical. TRUE, function produces plot addition returning data frame occurrence counts. ... parameters. See par() map().

title: Map the fossil records — pbdb_map
text: data frame number occurrences per coordinate.

title: Map the fossil records — pbdb_map
text: argument show = "coords" pbdb_occurrences() function required. recommend use cairo device (X11()) better visualization maps. See Examples.

title: Map the fossil records — pbdb_map
code: if (FALSE) {   data <- pbdb_occurrences(     limit = "all", vocab = "pbdb", base_name = "Canis", show = "coords"   )   X11(width = 12, height = 8)   pbdb_map(data)   pbdb_map(data, pch = 1)   pbdb_map(     data,     pch = 19,     col_point = c("pink", "red"),     col_ocean = "light blue",     main = "Canis"   ) }

what: Plot a raster showing the number of fossil occurrences — pbdb_map_occur
title: Plot a raster showing the number of fossil occurrences — pbdb_map_occur
text: Creates SpatRaster object plot sampling effort (number fossil records per cell).

title: Plot a raster showing the number of fossil occurrences — pbdb_map_occur
code: pbdb_map_occur(   data,   res = 5,   col_int = "white",   col_ocean = "black",   col_eff = c("light blue", "blue"),   do_plot = TRUE,   ... )

title: Plot a raster showing the number of fossil occurrences — pbdb_map_occur
text: data Input data frame. data frame output pbdb_occurrences() function using argument show = "coords". See also Details Examples. res resolution SpatRaster object (decimal degrees). See terra::res(). col_int colour mainland. col_ocean colour ocean. col_eff Two colours used generate colour gradient showing number occurrences per cell map. do_plot Logical. TRUE, function produces plot addition returning SpatRaster. ... parameters. See par() map()

title: Plot a raster showing the number of fossil occurrences — pbdb_map_occur
text: SpatRaster object sampling effort (number fossil records per cell). SpatRaster object resolution specified res argument. default res = 5. Users wish work objects type load package terra.

title: Plot a raster showing the number of fossil occurrences — pbdb_map_occur
text: argument show = "coords" pbdb_occurrences() function required. recommend use cairo device (X11()) better visualization maps. See Examples.

title: Plot a raster showing the number of fossil occurrences — pbdb_map_occur
code: if (FALSE) {   data <- pbdb_occurrences(     limit = "all", vocab = "pbdb", base_name = "Canis", show = "coords"   )   X11(width = 13, height = 7.8)   pbdb_map_occur(data, res = 2)   ## Get the raster object without plotting it   pbdb_map_occur(data, res = 3, do_plot = FALSE) }

what: Plot a raster showing the richness of taxa — pbdb_map_richness
title: Plot a raster showing the richness of taxa — pbdb_map_richness
text: Creates SpatRaster object plot richness species, genera, families, etc. per cell.

title: Plot a raster showing the richness of taxa — pbdb_map_richness
code: pbdb_map_richness(   data,   rank = c("species", "genus", "family", "order", "class", "phylum"),   do_plot = TRUE,   res = 5,   col_int = "white",   col_ocean = "black",   col_rich = c("light blue", "blue"),   title = "Taxonomic richness",   ... )

title: Plot a raster showing the richness of taxa — pbdb_map_richness
text: data Input data frame. data frame output pbdb_occurrences() function using argument show = c("coords", "classext"). See also Details Examples. rank Taxon rank richness calculated. options : "species", "genus", "family", "order", "class" "phylum".  default value "species". do_plot Logical. TRUE, function produces plot addition returning SpatRaster. res resolution SpatRaster object (decimal degrees). See terra::res(). col_int colour mainland. col_ocean colour ocean. col_rich Two colours used generate colour gradient showing richness per cell map. title title plot, positioned right legend. ... parameters. See par() map().

title: Plot a raster showing the richness of taxa — pbdb_map_richness
text: SpatRaster object richness specified taxon rank per cell. SpatRaster object resolution specified res argument. default res = 5. Users wish work objects type load package terra.

title: Plot a raster showing the richness of taxa — pbdb_map_richness
text: argument show = c("coords", "classext") pbdb_occurrences() function required. recommend use cairo device (X11()) better visualization graphs. See Examples.

title: Plot a raster showing the richness of taxa — pbdb_map_richness
code: if (FALSE) {   data <- pbdb_occurrences(     limit = 1000, vocab = "pbdb", base_name = "mammalia",     show = c("classext", "coords")   )   X11(width = 13, height = 7.8)   pbdb_map_richness(data, res = 8, rank = "genus")   pbdb_map_richness(data, res = 8, rank = "family")   ## Get the raster object without plotting the map   pbdb_map_richness(data, res = 8, rank = "family", do_plot = FALSE) }

what: Get information about specimen measurements — pbdb_measurements
title: Get information about specimen measurements — pbdb_measurements
text: Returns information measurements associated selected fossil specimens.

title: Get information about specimen measurements — pbdb_measurements
Get information about specimen measurements — pbdb_measurements
text: ... Arguments passed API.  See available arguments https://paleobiodb.org/data1.2/specs/measurements. following parameters can used retrieve measurements known list specimens, occurrences, collections. records matching specified parameters returned: spec_id: list specimen identifiers. occ_id: list occurrence identifiers. coll_id: list collection identifiers. possible return additional information along basic record following parameter: show: Possible values include: "spec": Includes core fields describing specimen measurement taken. "methods": Information collection methods used. See pbdb_occurrences() documentation explanation filtering parameters.

title: Get information about specimen measurements — pbdb_measurements
text: data frame information measurements match query.

title: Get information about specimen measurements — pbdb_measurements
code: if (FALSE) {   pbdb_measurements(     spec_id = c(1505, 30050),     show = c("spec", "class", "methods"),     vocab = "pbdb"   ) }

what: Get information about a single occurrence record — pbdb_occurrence
title: Get information about a single occurrence record — pbdb_occurrence
text: Returns information single occurrence record Paleobiology Database.

title: Get information about a single occurrence record — pbdb_occurrence
Get information about a single occurrence record — pbdb_occurrence
text: id Identifier occurrence. parameter required. ... Arguments passed API. See available arguments https://paleobiodb.org/data1.2/occs/single. E.g.: vocab: Set "pbdb" show complete name variables (default variables short 3-letter names). show: Select additional blocks information returned along basic record.  possible values include: "class": taxonomic classification occurence: phylum, class, order, family, genus. "coords": latitude longitude occurrence. "loc": Additional information geographic locality occurrence "stratext": Detailed information stratigraphic context occurrence. "lithext": Detailed information lithological context occurrence.

title: Get information about a single occurrence record — pbdb_occurrence
text: data frame single occurrence.

title: Get information about a single occurrence record — pbdb_occurrence
text: Documentation parameters available https://paleobiodb.org/data1.2/occs/single. parameter list , describe common filters paleontologists ecologists might use.

title: Get information about a single occurrence record — pbdb_occurrence
code: if (FALSE) {   pbdb_occurrence(id = 1001)   pbdb_occurrence(id = 1001, vocab = "pbdb", show = c("class", "coords")) }

what: Get information about fossil occurrence records — pbdb_occurrences
title: Get information about fossil occurrence records — pbdb_occurrences
text: Returns information fossil occurrence records stored Paleobiology Database.

title: Get information about fossil occurrence records — pbdb_occurrences
Get information about fossil occurrence records — pbdb_occurrences
text: ... Arguments passed API. See available arguments https://paleobiodb.org/data1.2/occs/list. limit: Limits number records returned. value may positive integer, zero, "". taxon_name: Return records associated specified taxonomic name(s).  may specify multiple names. base_name: Return records associated specified taxonomic name(s) children (e.g. base_name = "Canis" return "Canis", "Canis lupus", "Canis mosbachensis", etc.) lngmin: Numeric. longitude boundaries normalized fall -180 180. Note specify lngmin must also specify lngmax.  Returns records whose geographic location falls within given bounding box (defined lngmin, lngmax, latmin, latmax).  generates two adjacent bounding boxes range crosses antimeridian. lngmax: Numeric. longitude boundaries normalized fall -180 180. latmin: Numeric value -90 90.  Note specify latmin must also specify latmax. latmax: Numeric value -90 90. min_ma: Return records whose temporal locality least old, specified millions years. max_ma: Return records whose temporal locality old, specified millions years. interval: Return records whose temporal locality falls within named geologic time interval (e.g. "Miocene"). cc: Return records whose location falls within specified geographic regions. value parameter one two-character country codes /three-character continent codes comma-separated list (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2 https://paleobiodb.org/data1.2/config.txt?show=continents). parameter value starts !, records falling regions excluded instead included. country codes starting ^ subtracted filter. show: Show extra variables (e.g. "coords", "classext", "ident").

title: Get information about fossil occurrence records — pbdb_occurrences
text: data frame fossil occurrences.

title: Get information about fossil occurrence records — pbdb_occurrences
text: Documentation parameters available https://paleobiodb.org/data1.2/occs/list. describe common filters paleontologists ecologists might use parameter list . aware depending query, columns may returned API empty across rows.

title: Get information about fossil occurrence records — pbdb_occurrences
code: if (FALSE) {   pbdb_occurrences(id = c(10, 11), show = c("coords", "classext", "ident"))   pbdb_occurrences(     limit = "all", vocab = "pbdb", taxon_name = "Canis",     show = c("coords", "classext", "ident")   )   pbdb_occurrences(     limit = "all", vocab = "pbdb", base_name = "Canidae",     show = c("coords", "classext", "ident")   ) }

Get information about a single taxonomic opinion — pbdb_opinion
text: id Identifier opinion. parameter required. ... Arguments passed API. See documentation accepted parameters https://paleobiodb.org/data1.2/opinions/single. E.g.: vocab: Set "pbdb" show complete name variables (default variables short 3-letter names). show: Additional information shown along basic record.  possible values include: basis: basis opinion, can "stated evidence", "stated without evidence", "implied", "second hand". entname: names people authorized, entered modified record. refattr: author(s) year publication reference opinion entered.

title: Get information about a single taxonomic opinion — pbdb_opinion
text: data frame single taxonomic opinion.

title: Get information about a single taxonomic opinion — pbdb_opinion

what: Get information about multiple taxonomic opinions — pbdb_opinions
title: Get information about multiple taxonomic opinions — pbdb_opinions
text: Returns information multiple taxonomic opinions, selected according criteria taxon name. function used query opinions attributed particular author, show recently entered opinions.

title: Get information about multiple taxonomic opinions — pbdb_opinions
Get information about multiple taxonomic opinions — pbdb_opinions
text: ... Arguments passed API. See documentation accepted parameters https://paleobiodb.org/data1.2/opinions/list. E.g.: id: Selects opinions corresponding specified identifier(s). may provide one. op_author: Selects opinions attributed specified author. Note opinion author(s) may different author(s) reference opinion entered. parameter accepts last names , first initials. can specify one author name, case opinions match selected. ops_created_before: Select records associated taxa created specified date date/time. See https://paleobiodb.org/data1.2/datetime documentation specify date/time values. ops_created_after: Select records associated taxa created specified date date/time. See https://paleobiodb.org/data1.2/datetime documentation specify date/time values. op_type: can use parameter retrieve opinions, classification opinions, certain kinds opinions. default opinions. Accepted values include: "" (default), "class", "valid", "accepted", "junior", "invalid".

title: Get information about multiple taxonomic opinions — pbdb_opinions
text: data frame information taxonomic opinions match query.

what: Appearance of new taxa and extinctions across time — pbdb_orig_ext
title: Appearance of new taxa and extinctions across time — pbdb_orig_ext
text: Returns data frame appearance new taxa last appearances across time provided data optionally produces plot , showing new appearances last appearances.

title: Appearance of new taxa and extinctions across time — pbdb_orig_ext
code: pbdb_orig_ext(   data,   rank = c("species", "genus", "family", "order", "class", "phylum"),   temporal_extent,   res,   orig_ext = 1,   colour = "#0000FF30",   bord = "#0000FF",   ylab = NULL,   do_plot = TRUE )

title: Appearance of new taxa and extinctions across time — pbdb_orig_ext
text: data Data frame query PaleobioDB returned pbdb_occurrences().  Important: required show name families, orders, etc. data frame, set: show = c("classext", "ident") (see Examples). rank taxon rank analyzed. default value "species". temporal_extent Vector set temporal extent (min, max) res Numeric. Sets intervals temporal extent. orig_ext Set 1 plot number new appearances, 2 plot number extinctions. colour Colour area polygon plot. bord Colour border polygon. ylab label y axis. do_plot Logical value indicating whether produce plot (TRUE default).

title: Appearance of new taxa and extinctions across time — pbdb_orig_ext
text: data frame number first appearances extinctions selected taxon rank across time.

title: Appearance of new taxa and extinctions across time — pbdb_orig_ext
code: if (FALSE) {   canidae <- pbdb_occurrences(     limit = "all", vocab = "pbdb",     base_name = "Canidae", show = "classext"   )    # Plot of the evolutionary rates   pbdb_orig_ext(     canidae,     rank = "genus",     orig_ext = 1,     temporal_extent = c(0, 10), res = 1   )    # Plot of the extinction rates   pbdb_orig_ext(     canidae,     rank = "genus",     orig_ext = 2,     temporal_extent = c(0, 10), res = 1   ) }

See available arguments https://paleobiodb.org/data1.2/taxa/refs name: Returns information fundamental taxonomic name matching string.  % _ characters may used wildcards. id: Returns information taxonomic name corresponding identifier. may specify name id query. show: Show extra variables. rel: Set rel = "synonyms" select synonyms base taxon taxa; rel = "children" select taxa immediately contained within base taxon taxa; rel = "all_children" select taxa contained within matching taxon within synonymous taxa; rel = "all_parents" select taxa contain matching taxa. extant: Logical indicating whether select extant non-extant taxa.

title: Temporal variation in taxon richness — pbdb_richness

Sets duration intervals temporal extent. temporal_extent Numeric vector set temporal extent (min, max). colour Colour area polygon plot. bord Colour border polygon. ylab label y axis. do_plot Logical indicating whether produce plot (TRUE default).

code: if (FALSE) {   data <- pbdb_occurrences(     limit = "all",     vocab = "pbdb",     base_name = "Canidae",     show = "class"   )   pbdb_richness(data, rank = "species", res = 0.2, temporal_extent = c(0, 3)) }

title: Get information about geological strata — pbdb_strata
Get information about geological strata — pbdb_strata
text: ... Arguments passed API. See documentation accepted parameters https://paleobiodb.org/data1.2/strata/list. E.g.: name: full partial name. can use % _ wildcards. rank: Returns strata specified rank: "formation", "group" "member". lngmin: Numeric. longitude boundaries normalized fall -180 180. Note specify lngmin must also specify lngmax. Returns records whose geographic location falls within given bounding box (defined lngmin, lngmax, latmin, latmax). generates two adjacent bounding boxes range crosses antimeridian. lngmax: Numeric. longitude boundaries normalized fall -180 180. latmin: Numeric -90 90. Note specify latmin must also specify latmax. latmax: Numeric -90 90. loc: Return strata associated occurrence whose geographic location falls within specified geometry, specified WKT format. vocab: Set "pbdb" show complete name variables (default variables short 3-letter names).

title: Get information about geological strata — pbdb_strata
text: data frame information selected strata.

title: Get information about geological strata — pbdb_strata

Note specify lngmin must also specify lngmax. Returns records whose geographic location falls within given bounding box (defined lngmin, lngmax, latmin, latmax). generates two adjacent bounding boxes range crosses antimeridian. lngmax: Numeric. longitude boundaries normalized fall -180 180. latmin: Numeric -90 90. paleobioDB 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-02-29 new major version paleobioDB package uses new API version. possible code written previous versions might compatible. need run older code, might rewrite install older version package.

title: paleobioDB 1.0.0
text: Update API version 1.2 (#51, #57). new functions pbdb_specimen(), pbdb_specimens(), pbdb_ref_specimens(), pbdb_measurements() can used get information fossil specimens measurements associated . new functions pbdb_opinion(), pbdb_opinions() pbdb_opinions_taxa() can used get information taxonomic opinions.

title: paleobioDB 1.0.0
text: Methods package terra (instead raster) used functions plot return raster objects. Function argument names consistently use snake case now, argument names changed (e.g. .plot parameter available many plotting functions renamed do_plot). Query functions warn user records returned. Query functions report warnings generated API instead silently ignoring . pbdb_map_richness(), pbdb_richness(), pbdb_orig_ext(), now option provide title label y axis.

title: paleobioDB 1.0.0
text: pbdb_temp_range() plot, taxa names now readable (#22). pbdb_richness() prevents x axis title overlapping tick labels long (#43). Fix bug map plotting caused latitude longitude values returned strings API (#50). Fix certificate issue RCurl affected Windows users (#53, #54).

title: paleobioDB 1.0.0
text: Update documentation reflect parameter name changes version 1.2 API.

title: paleobioDB 0.7.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-07-25

title: paleobioDB 0.7.0
text: Ensures travis fails either API internal tests failure

title: paleobioDB 0.7.0
text: Fix issue 45 wrong API endpoint. Fix errors several functions rpbdb_temporal_functions.R

title: paleobioDB 0.6.0
text: CRAN release: 2019-02-26

title: paleobioDB 0.6.0
text: Integrates codecov Adds tests execution travis. Tests part CRAN check package since rely calling PaleobioDB API. Improves error reporting pbdb_temp_range. issue 28

title: paleobioDB 0.6.0
text: Fix error pbdb_occurrences R 3.5.

title: paleobioDB 0.5.0
text: CRAN release: 2016-09-02

title: paleobioDB 0.5.0
text: Fix bug JSON responses API started including “elapsed_time” “records” element.

title: paleobioDB 0.4.0
text: now functions exploring data paleobioDB use “matched_name” “matched_number” instead raw names raw taxon numbers former versions package. means default output richness first last occurrences species/genus/etc. changed. used original taxonomic identification fossil records, now use revised taxonomic identification fossil records.

title: paleobioDB 0.4.0
text: Fix duplicated records bug pbdb_occurrences caused API returning array two identical values field “reference_no”. now , filed returned API array mapped semicolon separated string.
